security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and visualization skill. Contains Python scripts for processing local YAML/JSON files and generating Mermaid diagrams. No network calls, no command execution, no sensitive data access.

content.user_title: Generate architecture diagrams from service metadata
content.value_statement: Teams struggle to visualize how microservices connect across repositories. This skill aggregates catalog-info.yaml files to automatically generate dependency graphs, request flow maps, and event topology diagrams using Mermaid.
actual_capabilities: Generate service dependency graphs from catalog-info.yaml metadata
Map request flows through API gateways to backend services
Visualize Kafka event topology between producers and consumers
Group services by domain, type, or owner in Markdown tables
Aggregate metadata from multiple repositories into unified model
limitations: Requires catalog-info.yaml files in each repository to function
Cannot generate views without pre-existing repository metadata
Limited to the schema defined in catalog-info.yaml specification

best_practices: Run /sync-all first to ensure all repositories have current catalog-info.yaml files
Review missing metadata list to identify repositories that need documentation
Use generated diagrams as living documentation by keeping metadata up to date
anti_patterns: Generating architecture views without first syncing repository metadata
Relying solely on diagrams without consulting actual catalog-info.yaml source files
Ignoring missing metadata warnings when analyzing system dependencies

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code and standard Claude. It generates Mermaid diagrams compatible with any Mermaid viewer.

faq.question: How many repositories can it process?
faq.answer: The skill can process any number of repositories. For large systems, it launches 5-10 subagents in parallel for efficiency.

faq.question: Does it require network access?
faq.answer: No network access is needed. It reads local catalog-info.yaml files and generates diagrams from local data only.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally on files you specify. No data is sent to external services or third parties.

faq.question: What if some repositories lack metadata?
faq.answer: Repositories without catalog-info.yaml are listed in the Missing Metadata section. The view still generates for available components.

faq.question: How is this different from other diagram tools?
faq.answer: This skill automatically generates diagrams from existing metadata. No manual diagram maintenance is required when services change.
